intro: Sclerodictyon griffonianum, commonly known as the African milkweed, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its woody stems and milky sap. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically yellow or greenish in color. Its leaves are usually opposite and have a rough texture. Sclerodictyon griffonianum is adapted to arid environments and is often found in savannahs and woodlands.
